item.title: Recognizing the 140th anniversary of the founding of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers, and congratulating the members and officers of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers for the union's many achievements.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads.

summary.text: Recognizes the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers, on its 140th anniversary, for its contribution to the structural development and building of the United States and to the well-being of tens of thousands of workers.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the Senate on May 8, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Recognizes the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers, on its 140th anniversary, for its contribution to the structural development and building of the United States and to the well-being of tens of thousands of workers.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the Senate on May 8, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Recognizes the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers, on its 140th anniversary, for its contribution to the structural development and building of the United States and to the well-being of tens of thousands of workers.
Recognizes the contributions of unions to the structural development and building of the United States and to the well-being of tens of thousands of workers.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
